newsitem.title: FRANCE: Saint-Gobain up on asset sale talk.
newsitem.headline: Saint-Gobain up on asset sale talk.

text.p: Shares in glassmaking group Saint-Gobain were up more than three percent in midday trading on Tuesday after company managers discussed the recent results and outlook in meetings with portfolio managers.
Saint-Gobain officials said there were two meetings with portfolio managers, one in London organised by Kleinwort Benson and one today in Paris organised by Cheuvreux de Virieu.
Brokerage Massonaud raised its rating on the stock to buy from neutral, portfolio managers said.
Saint-Gobain shares were up 20 francs at 664 at 1110 GMT.

One portfolio manager said the officials said activity was brisk this summer for the home improvements unit Polie, the Brazilian market was holding up well, and asset sales were expected as Saint-Gobain focussed on its core activities.
The company said it reiterated comments made last week when it issued its first-half results, which were initially taken poorly by the market. The share fell 2.3 percent on Friday.
